IX.iii.1.J.5.i
.
Example:  Covered Asset Amount
Example
:  The net worth limit is $123,600.  The claimant’s assets total $116,600 and the annual income is $0.  The claimant transferred $30,000 by giving it to a friend (during the look-back period) one year prior to applying for VA pension.
Result
:  If the claimant had not transferred the $30,000, the net worth would have been $146,600, which exceeds the net worth limit.  The claimant’s covered asset amount is $23,000, because this is the amount by which the claimant’s net worth would have exceeded the limit due to the covered asset.
title: M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section J - Net Worth, Asset Transfers, and Penalty Periods
